result.execSummary:
The defendant Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:21 PM Defendant Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed on the record. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Guilty Plea entered on Count #6 and #7. Defendant has not signed right to personal appearance paperwork, the Court discusses this with the defendant on the record. The defendant waives her right to personal appearance. The Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #6 and #7. Count #8 to be dismissed and read in. Defendant to pay $1158.00 plus $94.50 drug abuse surcharge. Payment plan accepted of  $25.00/month  First payment due no later than 10-02-2022. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

1:45 PM Defendant Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder appeared by video, in custody at Whiteside Co Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared in person for Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder.  Attorney Matt Lantta appeared  by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Murphy states they received a new offer from the state and he has not been able to review it with the DE. DE waived right to physically appear at plea and sentencing hearing. Atty Murphy is to file waiver of appearance with the plea questionnaire. Matter rescheduled.

01:15 PM  Nancy Louise Elizabeth Scudder, defendant appeared in Court in custody  by video means with counsel Adam Thomas Witt by video means .
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.    Defendant referred to apply with State Public Defender.  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.  Bond argued and set.
